channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Leinster Gardens, junction with Leinster Place - missing motar around access covers., 14th October
item.description:
Please remedy

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Leinster Place, Bayswater, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog waste all along the southern end of Holmdene Avenue on the even side of the road, 14th October
item.description:
There is a constant stream of dog waste on the even side of Holmdene Avenue from numbers 90 all the way up to 60. This road has a school at the bottom and has a large number of children on it at drop off and pick up time especially on the even side of the road. I counted 7 today of dog mess newly laid or been pressed into the pavement by children, parents, and other road walkers.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Holmdene Avenue, Dulwich Village, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Burnt down bed blocking stairway, 14th October
item.description:
Excessive fly tipping all along the stairs. The fly tipping has caught fire (likely due to the drug addicts that sit in the area and smoke) fire brigade have put the fire out and left the ash. My children and I use this walkway everyday to get to school. It is heavily used by parents in the area. Please can this be removed. Please can this issue be further escalated? We need a camera and some deterrents here to keep it clean. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 33, Sandy Hill Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2D;89, Carlton Grove, Peckham, London

item.title: In the road to the right of 3 Hampstead Hill Gardens, 14th October
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Hampstead Hill Gardens, Belsize Park, London

item.title: Dumped clothes next to bins outside 1 Marshalls Grove, SE18 5HR, 14th October
item.description:
A small pile of dumped items has been left on the pavement next to the bins outside 1 Marshalls Grove, SE18 5HR. I haven’t touched or opened the items, but they appear to be clothing from the outside. They were not left by our household. I noticed them this morning, 14 October 2025.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Marshalls Grove, Charlton Riverside, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street lighting, 14th October
item.description:
Various lights are out and it’s very dark at night time. Also overgrown shrubs and cuttings in the pavement
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 197, Rommany Road, West Norwood, London

item.title: Overhanging trees from private land onto pavement - first reported 23rd July, 14th October
item.description:
Overhanging trees from private land onto pavement - first reported 23rd July - Closed by Bromley Council 1st August having served a 28 day notice Not resolved by 1st Sept New report raised due to Bromley having closed the last one - This report closed today with - Bromley Council having served a 28 day notice Bromley council, stop sending letters which aren't being acted upon and make sure people can use the pavement instead of being forced into the road by parked cars! You've had nearly 3 months to get this sorted!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11, Station Road, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rotting rubbish, 14th October

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 65, Lisson Grove, Marylebone, London

item.title: Broken paving slab, 14th October
item.description:
I appreciate lampposts are being relocated but the slab which was dug out to replace the new post could not be used. I can appreciate this can happen because of the various services underground. But instead of replacing a whole slab the workman have patched it up and it looks a mess. We are waiting for the slabs to be put back round the new post and would appreciate if a new one can replace the broken one. Thankyou

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Park Avenue, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Brooksbys Walk, Hackney, London

item.title: Neo-nazi flags on streetlight, 14th October
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shooters Hill Road, Blackheath, London
